results.title: Confession from the Commander's diary: a narration in five parts
results.creator_credit: Alexander Sokurov, L. Semenova and Svetlana Voloshina
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Observing the rituals, gestures and trance-like states of his crew, a naval Commander ponders his life. How did he get here? What went wrong? And right? Will he ever know light again? Probing the dark, unspecified seas, the ship becomes contemporary Russia: dazzling midnight snowstorms; plain human actions shaped by centuries of weariness and wanting; persistence; inquiry.

results.title: Beak out
results.brief_description: A quietly humurous 3D computer animation set in the quiet after hours of a flightless bird museum. The stationary bird exhibits slowly come to life. One skeleton in waking, a pre-historic flightless bird, dreams of flying and is by ironic twist of fate, flung across the room to land on an aeroplane model. His flight, ironically, is short lived when both the flightless bird and the airplane crash together to the ground.

results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Ben McGill, David Atkinson, Robyn Blake, Bruce McGill, Jeane McGill, Jeremy Parker and Sunny McGill
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.

results.title: Reternity: design of the 20th century
results.creator_credit: Futurniture, Torbjorn Lenskog, Annika Eriksson and Johanna Ekstrom
results.brief_description: In the winter of 1996-97, four Swedish and two British artists took part in an exhibition centred on Torbjorn Lenskog’s extensive collection of 20th century design objects at the Swedish National Art Museum. Their works engaged with the social life of these objects as design icons, addressing everything from the mentality of collecting, through the ideologies that informed modernism to the cultural malleability of industrial products. For this CD-ROM box set these artist were invited once again to make work in relation to the collection, this time specifically for the digital medium. The goal, as for the exhibition, was to stage a kind of confrontation between different ways of looking at history and its products. In addition to their works, which encompass a wide range of media, the CDs contain a large number of advertising images and photographs of the products in use, as well as excerpts from over 60 post-war documentaries that shed light on the industrial and social context that informed the design and reception of the objects. Quicktime objects and panoramas provide a close up of the items in collection.

results.title: Ithaca
results.brief_description: A short 3D computer animation depicts a formation of ufos flying amongst the pyramids. A tour of some of the natural land forms around the world, we see mountains form, marbled rock formations and islands over a psychadelic sea. The ufo’s playfully fly amongst the various forms as if celebrating and surveying their creations.

results.title: The Greatest story untold
results.brief_description: A short animation using both 3D claymation and 2D hand-drawn animation. A caveman wanders through the snow back to his cave and family after a hunt to find his family telling their dreams of the future. The stories differ with visions of our contemporary life, aliens kidnapping humans, and battles between good and evil.

results.title: Street kid
results.brief_description: In this short animation using both claymation and computer animation, a street kid is forced to survive in a harsh environment. He hunts through bins for food and is driven by his desperate circumstances to beg. After unsuccessfully begging he returns to the alley and is approached by a man who appears to care but has dubious intentions, pushing drugs onto the young boy.

results.title: Autarky
results.brief_description: An exploration of the possibilities that the intergration of digital technology and the natural world can open up for women. Archetypal feminine symbols and themes suggest that resources for female empowerment and self-sufficency are to be found in the layers beneath the social construction of patriarchy

results.title: Frickenstein
results.brief_description: A crazy scientist and his hapless assistant Egor hatch a giant genetic chicken. Confronted by an angry mob the scientist convinces them that they can profit from such a creation
